verb.description: Dip or submerge in a liquid.
examples: immerse the paper in water for twenty minutes

verb.description: Involve oneself deeply in a particular activity or interest.
examples: she immersed herself in her work
she was still immersed in her thoughts

origin: Early 17th century: from Latin immers- dipped into, from the verb immergere, from in- in + mergere to dip.
